servinfo.title: Engine and Emission Control System Check
servinfo.ptxt: Refer to the following items for the details of each step.

test1.ptxt: Perform customer complaint analysis referring to “Customer Complaint Analysis”.

testgroup.title: DTC / Freeze frame data check, record and clearance

test1.ptxt: Check for DTC (including pending DTC) referring to “DTC / Freeze Frame Data Check, Record and Clearance”.

testgroup.question: Is there any DTC(s)?

action.ptxt: Print DTC and freeze frame data or write them down and clear them by referring to DTC Clearance:For Petrol Engine Model , and go to Step 3.

test1.ptxt: Perform visual inspection referring to “Visual Inspection”.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace malfunction part, and go to Step 11.

test1.ptxt: Perform visual inspection referring to “Visual Inspection”.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace malfunction part, and go to Step 11.

test1.ptxt: Confirm trouble symptom referring to “Trouble Symptom Confirmation”.

testgroup.title: Rechecking and record of DTC / Freeze frame data

test1.ptxt: Recheck for DTC and freeze frame data referring to DTC Check:For Petrol Engine Model .

testgroup.question: Is there any DTC(s)?

testgroup.title: Rechecking and record of DTC / Freeze frame data

test1.ptxt: Recheck for DTC and freeze frame data referring to DTC Check:For Petrol Engine Model .

testgroup.question: Is there any DTC(s)?

testgroup.title: Engine basic inspection and engine symptom diagnosis

test1.ptxt: Check and repair according to Engine Basic Inspection:For Petrol Engine Model and Engine Symptom Diagnosis:For Petrol Engine Model .

testgroup.question: Are check and repair complete?

action.ptxt: Check and repair malfunction part(s), and go to Step 11.

test1.ptxt: Check and repair according to applicable DTC diag. flow.

action.ptxt: Check and repair malfunction part(s), and go to Step 11.

test1.ptxt: Check for intermittent problems referring to “Intermittent Problems Check”.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace malfunction part(s), and go to Step 11.

testgroup.title: Final confirmation test

test1.ptxt: Perform final confirmation test referring to “Final Confirmation Test”.

testgroup.question: Is there any problem symptom, DTC or abnormal condition?

servinfosub.title: Step 1: Customer Complaint Analysis
servinfosub.ptxt: Record details of the problem (failure, complaint) and how it occurred as described by the customer. For this purpose, use of such an inspection form will facilitate collecting information to the point required for proper analysis and diagnosis.

attention3.ptxt: This form is a standard sample. It should be modified according to conditions characteristic of each market.

servinfosub.title: Step 2: DTC / Freeze Frame Data Check, Record and Clearance
servinfosub.ptxt: First, check DTC (including pending DTC), referring to DTC Check:For Petrol Engine Model . If DTC is indicated, print it and freeze frame data or write them down and then clear them by referring to DTC Clearance:For Petrol Engine Model . DTC indicates malfunction that occurred in the system but does not indicate whether it exists now or it occurred in the past and the normal condition has been restored now. To check which case applies, check the symptom in question according to Step 5 and recheck DTC according to Step 6 and 7.

Attempt to diagnose a trouble based on DTC in this step only or failure to clear the DTC in this step will lead to incorrect diagnosis, trouble diagnosis of a normal circuit or difficulty in troubleshooting.

servinfosub.title: Step 3 and 4: Visual Inspection
servinfosub.ptxt: As a preliminary step, be sure to perform visual check of the items that support proper function of the engine referring to Visual Inspection:For Petrol Engine Model .

servinfosub.title: Step 5: Trouble Symptom Confirmation
servinfosub.ptxt: Based on information obtained in Step 1: Customer Complaint Analysis and Step 2: DTC / Freeze Frame Data Check, Record and Clearance , confirm trouble symptoms. Also, reconfirm DTC according to “DTC Confirmation Procedure” described in each DTC diag. flow.

servinfosub.title: Step 6 and 7: Rechecking and Record of DTC / Freeze Frame Data
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC Check:For Petrol Engine Model for checking procedure.

servinfosub.title: Step 8: Engine Basic Inspection and Engine Symptom Diagnosis
servinfosub.ptxt: Perform basic engine check according to Engine Basic Inspection:For Petrol Engine Model first. When the end of the flow has been reached, check the parts of the system suspected as a possible cause referring to Engine Symptom Diagnosis:For Petrol Engine Model and based on symptoms appearing on the vehicle (symptoms obtained through steps of customer complaint analysis, trouble symptom confirmation and/or basic engine check) and repair or replace faulty parts, if any.

servinfosub.title: Step 9: Troubleshooting for DTC (See each DTC Diag. Flow)
servinfosub.ptxt: Based on the DTC indicated in Step 6 or 7 and referring to the applicable DTC diag. flow, locate the cause of the trouble, namely in a sensor, switch, wire harness, connector, actuator, ECM or other part and repair or replace faulty parts.

servinfosub.title: Step 10: Intermittent Problems Check
servinfosub.ptxt: Check parts where an intermittent trouble is easy to occur (e.g., wire harness, connector, etc.), referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection and related circuit of DTC recorded in Step 2.

servinfosub.title: Step 11: Final Confirmation Test
servinfosub.ptxt: Confirm that the problem symptom has gone and the engine is free from any abnormal conditions. If what has been repaired is related to the DTC, clear the DTC once, perform DTC confirmation procedure and confirm that no DTC is indicated.
